'''Delcatty''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''エネコロロ''' ''Enekororo'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Skitty}} when exposed to a [[Moon Stone]].

==Biology==
Delcatty is a quadruped, feline Pokémon with a mostly tan body. It has a pointed, whisker-like protrusion on each cheek. Its purple ears have three tufts of fur at the tips, and there is a purple ruff-like collar with pin-like extensions around its neck. It has slim legs with tiny, digitless paws. It also possesses a purple, flower-like tuft of hair on the end of its thin tail.

Delcatty is happy most of the time and rarely gets involved in conflicts. When it is disturbed, it just moves to another area instead of fighting. It prefers to do as it pleases at its own pace, so its daily routine is random. It is popular among female Trainers, and used in competitions for its style and sublime fur. It is nocturnal and active at dusk. It lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|forests}}. It does not have a permanent nest, and instead finds comfortable spots to sleep.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Dr Abby Delcatty.png|thumb|220px|left|Delcatty in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
Delcatty made its television debut in ''[[SS011|A Date With Delcatty]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Trainer}} named [[Georgio]]. [[Butch]] and [[Cassidy]] stole it from him, but with {{an|Misty}}'s and {{an|Casey}}'s help, he got it back. He then used it to {{pkmn|battle}} [[Misty's Corsola]] and Casey's {{p|Elekid}}.

Delcatty made its main series debut in ''[[AG060|Delcatty Got Your Tongue]]''. {{an|May}} met [[Top Coordinator]] and {{tc|Doctor|Pokémon Doctor}} [[Dr. Abby|Abby]], who has a Delcatty [[nickname]]d "Johnny."

[[Lila]] has a male Delcatty, which she used in the [[Contest Battle|Battle Round]] of the {{to|Celestic}} {{pkmn|Contest}} in ''[[DP095|Battling the Generation Gap!]]''. He was seen defeating a {{p|Donphan}} and a {{p|Crawdaunt}} before losing to {{an|Dawn}}'s {{TP|Dawn|Ambipom}} in the finals.

A Delcatty appeared in a flashback in ''[[XY088|A Trip Down Memory Train!]]'', where it was among the group of Pokémon that befriended [[Clemont's Bunnelby]] when it was still a wild Pokémon.

====Minor appearances====
Delcatty debuted in ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''.

A Delcatty appeared in ''[[DP091|One Team, Two Team, Red Team, Blue Team!]]''.

A Delcatty made a very brief appearance in ''[[DP183|League Unleashed!]]''.

A Delcatty appeared in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]''.

A Delcatty appeared in ''[[XY003|A Battle of Aerial Mobility!]]''.

A Delcatty appeared in ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]''.

A Delcatty appeared in ''[[XY047|Dreaming a Performer's Dream!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Delcatty appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Kiki.png|thumb|125px|Delcatty in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga===
{{main|Kiki}}
In ''[[PS194|Guile from Mawile]]'', {{adv|Ruby}}'s Skitty, Kiki, evolved when she touched a [[Moon Stone]] on [[Steven Stone]]'s belt.

A Delcatty was used by {{adv|Emerald}} during his [[Battle Factory|Factory]] challenge in ''[[PS306|Pinsir Me, I Must Be Dreaming]]''.

A Delcatty appeared in ''[[PS315|Skirting Around Surskit I]]'' as a rental Pokémon that [[Guile Hideout]] stole.

==Trivia==
* As of [[Generation VII]], Delcatty's {{EV}} yield (1 HP, 1 Speed) is unique.

===Origin===
Delcatty is based on a domestic cat. It may also draw inspiration from {{wp|lynx}}es, cats with a ruffed face and tufted ears. Delcatty's collar resembles a neck pillow, which could be a reference to the fact it sleeps whenever and wherever it decides.

====Name origin====
Delcatty is a combination of ''delicate'' and ''catty''.

Enekororo is a combination of 狗尾草 ''enokorogusa'' ({{wp|Foxtail (diaspore)|foxtail grass}}), 猫 ''neko'' ({{wp|cat}}), and 心 ''kokoro'' (heart).
